intro: Oenothera carinthiaca, commonly known as the Carpathian evening primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Europe. It features showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically 2–4 inches in diameter, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center. Oenothera carinthiaca is often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
